title: How often should you see someone in a long-distance relationship? - Quora

response.answer_text: Approximately once a month, Dave and I meet up. Generally, I go down to Virginia - we live about 5 hours away from one another - but occasionally he comes up here. It would make more sense financially for him to come here more often, since I have a place here and down there we need to get a hotel room because he lives with his parents for the time being, but with his work schedule and older car, it’s not as easy for him to get up here and I don’t mind the drive regardless. Soon though, I’m moving back into my parents’ home for a few months to save up some cash and look actively for a different job, so that’s gonna change too. I’m fairly certain we’ll be skipping the month of September for our visit. Our relationship’s been a bit rocky lately, and on top of it we’ve both got some bills coming up and a few odd payments on other things that just are making this harder than normal. We were supposed to visit on the 22nd of September, but I mentioned potentially pushing it off until the following weekend and he wasn’t opposed, just said we can feel it out. Today, I secretly booked a hotel room (tentatively, with a cancellation option) for the last weekend of the month since rates are super cheap because of the hurricane - so I wanted to lock that in before they go up and everyone is scrambling to get a cheap room. I’m not gonna tell him until we discuss it further but I have a few weeks still and don’t wanna put the pressure on to make it seem like I have to see him, even though I want to so badly. We both do. We just know things are tight right now and, unfortunately, things happen. We’re hoping to close distance sometime, but we gotta get there first. So, for now, we’re hanging onto those one-a-month-ish visits and hoping it all pans out the way optimism wants it to.

Funny how when you add a few miles the view of a relationship changes to locality? People in love visit each other everyday no matter where they are. They are together wherever their hearts are. I might suggest there are more couples that lay next to each other that are worlds apart more so than two hearts that are in love that have miles to conquer. The touch of your hand on me erodes walls to a memory you gave to me with a touching from eternity. It is a felt love that springs forth from within. Love within brings you to me with every breath, every thought, and that kiss passes tomorrow into today. Many can be next to each other, but not know each other. So now I ask you, “How often should couples in a long distance relationship visit each other?” You feel love completely wherever you are when you allow love in. The greatest love is within you no matter where you rest your head. To be loved is only where you allow your heart to exist. Give me your heart and I will show you true love. I took yours. Do you see where it is? It is where you are. :) you were just visited.
